The explanation of each faculty [sn48.38: Physical enjoyment, physical pleasure, the enjoyable, pleasant feeling that’s born from physical contact. This is called the faculty of pleasure.
Physical pain, physical displeasure, the painful, unpleasant feeling that’s born from physical contact. This is called the faculty of pain.
Mental enjoyment, mental pleasure, the enjoyable, pleasant feeling that’s born from mind contact. This is called the faculty of happiness.
Mental pain, mental displeasure, the painful, unpleasant feeling that’s born from mind contact. This is called the faculty of sadness.
Neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling, whether physical or mental. This is the faculty of equanimity.
The categorization of the faculties [sn4: The faculties of pleasure and happiness should be seen as pleasant feeling.
The faculties of pain and sadness should be seen as painful feeling.
The faculty of equanimity should be seen as neutral feeling.
